body: @kazum The new implementation is clean and elegant!

@Huyuwei 
Pls  review.
This change due to different way of expecting the weights shape for NHWC and NCHW.
I have checked the compute definition of both depthwise and arrived at this.
If we are good with this, I will add a test case for NHWC-depthwise.

@masahi 

Nearest neighbor & bi-linear can be used for both up/down.
Yes, pooling is equivalent to down sample (based on max/avg/ ..etc).
Asymmetric down sample is not possible with pooling (tensor flow has use case of asymmetric down sample with bi-linear).

I could go with upsampling with bilinear/nn to upsample.
Then we might need to add new operator downsampling with bilinear/nn only for down sampling.

I was just trying to generalize it as scale for up/down with nn/bilinear modes.

@tqchen  pls advice.
@Huyuwei : your comment is handled now...
I am attending one training of company at HangZhou and not take the computer. So @masahi and @tqchen could have a look

Regarding tensorflow's down sampling op, are you talking about [this](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/image/resize_images)? This seems too specific to tensorflow, and I guess tf needs this op because of its programming model.  I'm not sure if it is within the scope of what tvm wants to cover.

Anyway, here are my take on this. I am open to others' opinion.

* I don't like the name "scale". "upsampling" is the common name used by other frameworks as well.
* "upsampling" op with nn/bilinear interpolation makes most sense and should cover most use cases.
* I don't know what is the need for in-network nn/bilinear down sampling. Isn't pooling followed by convolution sufficient?  Supporting all combination of nn/bilinear & up/down scaling under the name "scale" seems over-engineering.

Take a look at ONNX's upsampling op spec [here](https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/master/docs/Operators.md#Upsample), for example.

@masahi 
Yes, that was the TF reference.

From NNVM we support multiple frontends.
I choose this unified version because it covers all frameworks under single operator of NNVM.

I can quickly rework to go with 

- Upsampling nn/bilinear 

- Downsampling nn/bilinear.

@tqchen  please advice.
There is an unintended change that reverts the submodule to an older version. Please update the submodule (HalideIR) to the latest version. You can do it by git pull under the HalideIR folder

Refer to https://docs.python.org/3/library/multiprocessing.html#contexts-and-start-methods, spawn starts a fresh process and can be slower than fork. 

Let us add an option to args to rpc_server, ```--no-fork``` to force use of spawn and document the possible problems related to fork. The default behavior works fine for many cases already.
@kevinthesun @nishi-t  can you help review this?

Thanks for all the reviewer's comments, I see two major things that we want to improve in here.

- The nms operator is separated in the code, but not being separated in the nnvm. 
   - As @zhreshold suggested, we might want to split the multiboxprior into several ops so that nms can be its own op and we don't have to introduce the bulk op in here
   - We need to support gluon-cv models
- The split extra op API is a bit hacky, this is not the fault of this PR but reveals a limitation in current graph runtime. A proper solution would add cross-device API to NNVM, I will add that in an RFC
created https://github.com/dmlc/tvm/issues/1242

HI @tqchen 

this issue is also related to: https://github.com/dmlc/nnvm/issues/433

Can you please suggest me how to fix this issue so that I can import the ONNX model via NNVM FrontEnd.
Although it will be slower, spawn will greatly avoid massive potential "compiler internal error" caused by forking.
@zheng-da @reminisce Since they are working on subgraphs.

@colin1988 

I mean our tensorflow frontend now doesn't support Gather now.

I see "take" operator is added to tvm already and nnvm operator for the same is pending.
We could use this to support Gather.

How about splitting as Upsampling and Downsampling ?

make: *** No rule to make target 'topi/include/topi/nn/scale.h', needed by 'build/topi/topi.o'. Stop.

yeah that's better. And mxnet and keras frontend should call tvm upsampling op for their corresponding symbol / layer.  

If you really want to support tensorflow image ops,  you can put scaling and other image ops into topi/vision directory.

Great. To summarize.

- I will leave existing Upsampling with just conversion from Python to cpp at tvm/topi. 

- Add new operator scale under vision to support bilinear up/down.
don't forget to add a bilinear option to the existing upsampling op. You can call your new bilinear interpolation function from the upsampling op.
Sure. Noted.
@kevinthesun i test a mxnet ssd model，all layer is normal except SoftmaxActivation（mode=channel）. Did you find this problem?

@masahi 

New patches added as per the discussion for review.

- Upsampling extended with "mode" to support bilinear.

- resize operator added under vision.

@tqchen & @Huyuwei 
All review comments handled here. Hope we are good to go now.

@srkreddy1238 

It works after patching from_tensorflow.py with mobilenetv1 model. However, I noticed performance is quite poor.

On RK3399 which has dual-core Cortex-A72 + quad-core Cortex-A53 platform, time spent  after 1st iteration:

from_tensorflow.py: 0.45sec 

Thanks,

Does Mali GPU support NHWC?

Thanks,

Please move resize -> topi.image.resize, as this is image preprocessing.  Vision operators are supposed to be used in later stages in vision pipeline.

It would be great if the implementation can be redirected into one, although there is both upsampling and resize API. 

As per http://docs.tvm.ai/contribute/code_review.html#documentations-are-mandatory, please also update docs/api/python to make sure the new API will appear in the docs once get merged.

await approval from @masahi @FrozenGene
await approval from @piiswrong we want to merge this in so it won't block @zheng-da
need rebase from master

so there is upsampling op and resize op, both of which call into "scale" function.
as @tqchen said, just merge resize and scale function and call it resize, and let upsampling op call into resize op.
@sanallen Did you test with ssd in mxnet example? That should work since the model is used in tutorial. SoftmaxActivation conversion is also added in this PR.

@tqchen It is easy to break multi box_detection into two ops(In tvm we have already done so). For gluon-cv support, I can add missing ops. Maybe this can be done in another PR. The split extra op in this PR purely serves for a solution for SSD on gpu. Since @Laurawly is implementing multi box ops for gpu. Maybe we can remove this hacky solution from this PR and move the discussion to RFC?
@kevinthesun sounds good to me

@kaishijeng 

from_tensorflow.py is written for inception V1 and input here is a jpeg encoded stream.

Mobilenet require decoded frame as input in shape [1, 224, 224, 3].

You could use the same numpy array  'x' as input for tensorflow too.
Good to hear that :+1:

@kevinthesun thank you for your reply. i tested a standard mxnet ssd example（base model is resnet50）. but my target is quad-core arm cortex-a7 chips（gcc toolchain is **gcc-linaro-arm-linux-gnueabihf-4.9-2014.09_linux**）, i find the reason is gcc toolchain error when gcc compile the fllowing code:
https://github.com/dmlc/tvm/blob/b877687fbeb8a6c12b62aac9869f7e54091395f4/topi/include/topi/nn/softmax.h#L63-L67

I check the lower llvm ir, it is normal.

Additional, i test three arm chips. Only the **gcc-linaro-arm-linux-gnueabihf-4.9-2014.09_linux** compiler appear a mistake.

@tqchen any other review comments ?
I go through using my mobile. maybe omit somethings. Where is the align_corners used in the resize_bilinear? Do you test in the OpenCL platform?

since it is not a general feature that we are propose to acting on, maybe it is better move discussion to https://discuss.tvm.ai/ where we can propose such change and discuss how it can be implemented
Removed building extra from this PR. Split multibox_detection into multibox_transform_loc and nms.
@sanallen Thank you for raising this issue. Maybe you can file an issue about this problem.

@FrozenGene 
 align_corners affect in bilinear is while weights calculation only. Pls check the biliner weights API.
OpenCL issue is with align_corners in nearest neighbour where we need to add support for floor ops.
I will work on floor operator for all platforms and then relook into align_corner for nn.

Bilinear don't have any impact with OpenCL.
If I don’t remember wrongly, I remember Bilinear also has floor operation. How do you resolve it?
That's in weights precompute. Where I used math lib as it's the compile time.
How about my code review’s comment? what is the meaning of 4?

The 4 in weights dimension ?

I have added the description now.

Yes. The image.py 

weights = np.empty([new_h, new_w, 4], dtype='float32')

Thanks for contributing this PR.

There are arguably two ways in this. The previous philosophy was to avoid positional arguments and  just use assignment, since this brings quite change to current code, I won;t merge this in for now. One minor comment on the proposed change: we can avoid std::move and directly use copy constructor and c++ will optimize it away

OK, maybe an easier way is to add an optimization to remove flatten in nnvm when it is not necessary. I am going to merge this in for now
